Ğ˜Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ°Ñ,Ğ½Ğ¾ ĞµÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ±Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¸)

Game design & Balance
ğŸ—¹â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜

Non existent. There's literally "iridescent addons" (extremely rare items) in the game lets you do 2x damage. Imagine if you could equip some rare item in Overwatch that lets you do 2x damage for a match in ranked. It doesn't matter if this item is rare, it's utter garbage that such a mechanic is even implemented, and goes to show just how incompetent the developers are.

Or what about an item that instantly makes you lose the game, but only if you're performing well? A key will let survivors escape through "the hatch" and instantly win, meaning there's no incentive to kill survivors beyond a certain threshold, since that will make the hatch spawn sooner. That's why you see so many killers "slug", i.e. just leave survivors on the ground instead of "hooking" them (i.e. kill them), so they prevent the hatch from spawning and thus they can continue searching for the remaining players. Makes the game very fun for everyone involved, right? Especially the person on the ground?

Not to mention how the game incentivizes killers to "tunnel" (essentially only focusing on one survivor at a time to eliminate them from the game). Surely is a fun experience being targeted, being instantly downed when unhooked, never really getting the chance to play.

Performance
ğŸ—¹â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜

I'm playing on a Ryzen 9 5900X with a GeForce 3060, and I still get occasional slowdows down to the 20 FPS range. Furthermore, the game is hardlocked to 60 fps.

Grinding
ğŸ—¹â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜

DBD has by far the worst grinding I've ever seen in any game. The amount of hours and money you have to put in to acquire the build you're going for is astronomical. It makes it very difficult to play with friends, since they will be so far behind and the amount of time required to get on par is simply too much.

Networking
ğŸ—¹â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜

The networking in this game leaves a lot to be desired. It straight up does not work at times, or only considers one player when applying damage. I.e., they're using shooter networking mechanics ("always favor the shooter") in melee focused game and that isn't fair. There's a reason fighter games have since long abandoned this paradigm, since you need to consider both parties. If you dodge an attack, it shouldn't be applied, but here it doesn't matter. You can be far away, dodge or even not be in the same room as the killer (with margins of meters) - it doesn't matter. If they hit you on their screen, it'll count as a hit regardless if it actually hit or not. The game can literally communicate to you that you managed to successfully dodge an attack, and yet you're on the ground from being hit. That's the kind of networking this game has.

In addition to this, you will be randomly disconnected from games at times, and if you are, you will be punished for it. It doesn't matter why - whether it be their own servers going down, steam going down or something else - if you aren't there until the end of a game you will get a temporary ban and lose ranking as well.

Community
ğŸ—¹â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜

The community in DBD is infamous for its toxicity. Be prepared to become a true zen master if you can tolerate what you will be exposed to in this game, because it won't be pleasant. We're talking about going up against complete psychopaths that will take pleasure in refusing to end the game, even if they can, because they'd rather let you crawl on the ground to intentionally waste your time. Bonus points if they let you crawl right up to the hatch that would let you escape just before finally deciding to pick you up and hook you. They just wanted to let you taste victory before snatching it away right in front of your eyes.

Or how about body blocking you in an enclosed room for the entirety of the game, so you can't get out, until the game finally comes to an end 15 minutes later when "the entity" (omni-potent NPC) finally takes you. I've had that happen. Want to quit and find a new match? You can't, the game will punish you for it, so your only choice is to stay.

Survivors aren't any better. Aggravating the killer by making annoying noises or animations is very common, and it'll happen at any opportunity that are given.

Given the lame and tone deaf game design choices, it's like people carry a constant frustration against eachother, so any chance that are given to let you tease the other side is always taken and it's like it's almost incentivized.

Addicting
â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜â˜ğŸ—¹â˜â˜

Despite all its flaws, DBD is extremely addicting, but it's a negative form of addiction. It's like a constant torrent of frustration thrown your way, but occasionally, the game will reward you, which does feel great. Furthermore, the extreme grind becomes a sunk cost fallacy, almost forcing you to play more. Most of the time, you'll feel like utter crap playing this though.

This game is totally awesome. It's so cool! I highly recommend it! The first few hours of playing it, it will actually raise your heart level and might even give you a scare at certain moments, like when the killer sneaks up on you and you need to run for your life. It's a great game. The graphics are not great though, but this doesn't affect the gameplay and fun of it. The map designs and scenery is very spooky. Everybody has to play this game. It's an absolutely legendary horror game. So stimulating!

So this is a great game and all. But you really need to penalize the people who face camp hooked survivors. Like what is the point of a game that everytime someone is hooked you cant be rescued because the killer just trolls the area around you. Should make it so people who dont leave heart beat radius of a hooker survivor cant play killer for so many hours. Lack of penalizing people is what creates this toxic ass game you have atm.
it is very fun to play with friends, and also to play alone as a killer

Dead By Daylight: I spent 20 Dollars to run in circles and get hit with wooden Pallets
10/10

Game that looks simple when buying but proves to become a game of solid thought for newer players to manoeuvre their way through these maps. Enjoyable team game for those who play in the survivor role and a solid solo game for those wanting to kill online randoms. Good graphics and gameplay with little bugs, would recommend to try this game out for the adrenaline that comes with it. Great fun :)
